availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Joseph B. Northcutt (Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Fleming County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin Northcutt and Martha Northcutt. Married to Louisa Northcutt. Father of Martha A. Northcutt, Benjamin S. Northcutt, James C. Northcutt, Lucretia P. Northcutt, Lon E. Northcutt, Mary C. Northcutt, and William H. Northcutt. Farmer in Fleming County in 1860. Hired out two enslaved persons from J. B. Emmons in 1860. Justice of the peace for Hillsboro District No. 4 in Fleming County in 1865.

bibl.p: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Fleming County, 2nd Division, p. 401A; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedule, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 42-43; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedule, Kentucky, Fleming County, District 2, p. 8; KYR-0001-007-0354.
